qas.question: What is used asphalt turned back into?
How much of yearly acquired asphalt is reclaimed?
What percentage of new roadways are surfaced with asphalt?
During what action is asphalt often reclaimed?
For what reason is asphalt removed from a road?
Where can the removed surveys be returned for processing into new mixtures?
Where is the deactivated asphalt put back to use?
99% percent of what are constructed by using asphalt?
How often does the Federal Asphalt Administration conduct surveys?
99% of asphalt that is removed from road surfaces during what type of projects is reused for conducting industry surveys?

context: When <a3_0>maintenance<a3_0/> is performed on asphalt pavements, such as milling to remove a <a4_0>worn or damaged<a4_0/> surface, the removed material can be returned to <b5_0>a facility<b5_0/> for processing into <a0_0>new pavement mixtures<a0_0/>. The asphalt/bitumen in the removed material can be reactivated and put back to use in <b6_0>new pavement mixes<b6_0/>. With some <a2_0>95%<a2_0/> of <b7_0>paved roads<b7_0/> being constructed of or surfaced with asphalt, a substantial amount of asphalt pavement material is reclaimed each year. According to industry surveys conducted <b8_0>annually<b8_0/> by the Federal Highway Administration and the National Asphalt Pavement Association, more than <a1_0>99%<a1_0/> of the asphalt removed each year from road surfaces during <b9_0>widening and resurfacing<b9_0/> projects is reused as part of new pavements, roadbeds, shoulders and embankments.
